content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="/xsl/oairepository/oai2.xsl.v1.0" ?> <OAI-PMH xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/OAI-PMH.xsd"> <responseDate>2015-03-15T22:57:07Z</responseDate><request verb="ListRecords" set="user-coar" metadataPrefix="oai_dc">http://zenodo.org/oai2d</request><ListRecords> <record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12384</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-27T18:16:38Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>McCutcheon, Valerie</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Nixon, William</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Repository Profile: University of Glasgow: "Enlighten" IR & Research System. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12384</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12384</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>The University of Glasgow has established the &ldquo;Enlighten&rdquo; IR and Research system. The IR holds 72,000 items for institutional peer-reviewed journal articles, published conference papers, books and book chapters.</p>  <p>The Research System is an in-house-built system holding research information for institutional research activity, including people, organisations, projects and outputs. It is dynamically linked to the Enlighten IR.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12475</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-30T11:29:22Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Ribeiro, L\ufffd\ufffdgia Maria</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Repository Profile: Repository and CRIS at the University of Porto. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12475</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12475</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>At the University of Porto (U.Porto) both repository and CRIS are being used as part of the local e-infrastructure. U.Porto Open Repository is the largest institutional repository on RCAAP, the Portuguese Open Access Scientific Repository, hosting 32.616 full text CC-BY works as of September 2014.</p>  <p>SIGARRA-CRIS and U.Porto Open Repository are interoperable. When on the SIGARRA-CRIS the full text of a publication is registered and available on a CC BY basis both the corresponding metadata and the digital object are automatically transferred to the U.Porto Open Repository.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12477</identifier><datestamp>2014-10-30T10:28:59Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Moreira, Jo\ufffd\ufffdo</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Repository Profile: RCAAP & PTCRIS. COAR Repository Observatory</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12477</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12477</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>RCAAP (Reposit&oacute;rio Cientifico de Acesso Aberto de Portugal) is the main instrument for open access development in Portugal. It is a national open access initiative with 42 Institutional Repositories, one shared repository with 30 institutions, 30 Scientific journals and ore than 185.000 OA docs.</p>  <p>PTCRIS is a program that aims to ensure the creation and sustained development of a national integrated information ecosystem (PTCRIS) to support research management.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12561</identifier><datestamp>2014-11-14T10:52:45Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Barros, Beatr\ufffd\ufffdz</dc:creator>   <dc:title>Repository Profile: REPOSITAN. The Open Access Repository: Citizen view of the research in Andaluc\ufffd\ufffda, Spain</dc:title>   <dc:date>2014-10-16</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12561</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12561</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>REPOSITAN is the official name of the institutional Open Access Respository for the Region of Andalusia hosted by CEICE, the regional ministery that funds research, development and innovation projects within the whole region. The repository is part of SICA2, the second generation of an institutional Competence Research Information System.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12562</identifier><datestamp>2015-01-27T09:11:46Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-osr</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Rodrigues, Eloy</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Clobridge, Abby</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>COAR Working Group 2: Repository Interoperability</dc:creator>   <dc:title>The Case for Interoperability for Open Access Repositories</dc:title>   <dc:date>2011-07-08</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12562</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12562</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>Open Access repositories, whose number has been steadily rising, are an important component of the global e-Research infrastructure. The real value of repositories lies in the potential to interconnect them to create a network of repositories, a network that can provide unified access to research outputs and be (re-) used by machines and researchers. However, in order to achieve this potential, we need interoperability. The purpose of this paper is to provide a high-level overview of interoperability of Open Access repositories, identify the major issues and challenges that need to be addressed, stimulate the engagement of the repository community and launch a process that will lead to the establishment of a COAR roadmap for repository interoperability.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12563</identifier><datestamp>2015-01-27T09:11:46Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>user-osr</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>Rodrigues, Eloy</dc:creator>   <dc:creator>Clobridge, Abby</dc:creator>   <dc:title>El caso de Interoperabilidad para Repositorios de Acceso Abierto</dc:title>   <dc:date>2011-07-08</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12563</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12563</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>Los Repositorios de Acceso Abierto, cuyo nombre ha ido en aumento, son un componente importante de la infraestructura de e-investigaci&oacute;n. El valor real de los repositorios recae en el potencial de interconexi&oacute;n para crear una red de repositorios, una red que puede proveer un acceso unificado a los resultados de la investigaci&oacute;n y son (re-) utilizados por las m&aacute;quinas y los investigadores.<br /> Sin embargo, para lograr este potencial, necesitamos interoperabilidad. El prop&oacute;sito de este documento es proporcionar un visi&oacute;n general de alto nivel de interoperabilidad de los Repositorios de Acceso Abierto, identificar los principales problemas y retos que deben abordarse, estimular la participaci&oacute;n de la comunidad repositorio y poner en marcha un proceso que dirija a la creaci&oacute;n de una hoja de ruta para la interoperabilidad del repositorio.</p></dc:description>   <dc:publisher/>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record><record><header><identifier>oai:zenodo.org:12564</identifier><datestamp>2014-11-14T10:52:45Z</datestamp><setSpec>user-coar</setSpec><setSpec>user-zenodo</setSpec><setSpec>openaire</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd">   <dc:creator>COAR Working Group 2: Repository Interoperability</dc:creator>   <dc:title>The Current State of Open Access Repository Interoperability (2012)</dc:title>   <dc:date>2012-10-26</dc:date>   <dc:subject>cc-by</dc:subject>   <dc:identifier>http://zenodo.org/record/12564</dc:identifier>   <dc:identifier>           doi:10.5281/zenodo.12564</dc:identifier>   <dc:description><p>The report provides an overview of the current interoperability landscape in terms of the types of services that are now possible because of recent research and development efforts from throughout the Open Access community. The report covers seven areas of focus for current interoperability initiatives, and it provides overviews of nineteen key interoperability initiatives.</p>  <p>The intended audience includes institutions and repository managers operating at different points in terms of infrastructure, resources, and institutional support. For institutions new to Open Access and repositories, the report aims to provide guidance for getting started and indicates which interoperability initiatives are necessary to implement in order to achieve specific services. For institutions and repository managers already involved in OA and repositories, the report may provide ideas for additional functionality to add to your repository or further services that are possible to provide to your community.</p></dc:description>   <dc:rights>         info:eu-repo/semantics/openAccess       </dc:rights>   <dc:type>       info:eu-repo/semantics/article     </dc:type> </oai_dc:dc> </metadata></record></ListRecords> </OAI-PMH>
